The white chocolate and boysenberry flavours make it an absolute treat!","datePublished":"2021-05-14T13:09:19+00:00","image":["https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Boysenberry-White-Chocolate-Cheesecake-8.jpg","https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Boysenberry-White-Chocolate-Cheesecake-8-500x500.jpg","https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Boysenberry-White-Chocolate-Cheesecake-8-500x375.jpg","https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Boysenberry-White-Chocolate-Cheesecake-8-480x270.jpg"],"recipeYield":["8","8 people"],"prepTime":"PT45M","totalTime":"PT405M","recipeIngredient":["250 gram packet of gingernuts. crushed","¼ cup caster sugar","125 grams butter (, melted)","300 milliliters cream (, divided)","1 x 190 gram block Countdown Belgian white chocolate","2 x 225 gram  blocks cream cheese (, softened)","2 Tablespoons caster sugar","2 Tablespoons icing sugar ((optional for a slightly sweeter and thicker cheesecake))","1 teaspoon lemon juice","1 cup frozen boysenberries (, thawed and drained)","1 Tablespoon maple syrup"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Put the frozen berries in a small sieve to thaw and drain over a bowl. Remove from heat and put in the fridge to cool until needed.","name":"Put the frozen berries in a small sieve to thaw and drain over a bowl. Remove from heat and put in the fridge to cool until needed.","url":"https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/boysenberry-white-chocolate-no-bake-cheesecake/#wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-0"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Crush the biscuits using a food processor, blender or in a bag with a rolling pin. Stir in the caster sugar and melted butter and press into a 23cm/9 inch round springform cake tin. Use a measuring cup to make sure the base is pressed down really firmly so that it holds together when set. Place the tin in the fridge to start setting.","name":"Crush the biscuits using a food processor, blender or in a bag with a rolling pin. Stir in the caster sugar and melted butter and press into a 23cm/9 inch round springform cake tin. Use a measuring cup to make sure the base is pressed down really firmly so that it holds together when set. Place the tin in the fridge to start setting.","url":"https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/boysenberry-white-chocolate-no-bake-cheesecake/#wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-1"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"In a heatproof bowl combine ¼ cup of the cream with the chocolate and microwave in 20 second increments, stirring each time until melted or place the bowl over a pot of water on a medium heat and stir until melted. Allow to cool slightly.","url":"https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/boysenberry-white-chocolate-no-bake-cheesecake/#wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-2"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Using a handheld or stand mixer with the whisk attachment, whip the remaining cream until stiff peaks form. Gently fold through the whipped cream.","name":"Using a handheld or stand mixer with the paddle attachment whip the cream cheese and caster sugar for 3-4 minutes on medium-high speed until the mixture is fluffy and there are no lumps of cream cheese. Gently fold through the whipped cream.","url":"https://www.thekiwicountrygirl.com/boysenberry-white-chocolate-no-bake-cheesecake/#wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-4"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Spoon half of the filling onto the biscuit base. 			.a-stats {
				--akismet-color-mid-green: #357b49;

				--akismet-color-light-grey: #f6f7f7;

				max-width: 350px;
				width: auto;
			}

				box-sizing: border-box;
			}

				text-decoration: none;
				transition: all 0.2s ease;

			/* Extra specificity to deal with TwentyTwentyOne focus style */

				background: var(--akismet-color-mid-green);
				color: var(--akismet-color-white);

			}

<style type="text/css">
	.feast-category-index-list, .fsri-list {
		display: grid;
		grid-template-columns: repeat(2, minmax(0, 1fr) );
		grid-gap: 57px 17px;
		list-style: none;
		list-style-type: none;
		margin: 17px 0 !important;
	}
	.feast-category-index-list li, .fsri-list li {
		min-height: 150px;
		text-align: center;
		position: relative;
		list-style: none !important;
		margin-left: 0 !important;
		list-style-type: none !important;
		overflow: hidden;
	}
	.feast-category-index-list li a.title {
		text-decoration: none;
	}
	.feast-category-index-list-overlay .fsci-title {
		position: absolute;
		top: 88%;
		left: 50%;
		transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
		background: #FFF;
		padding: 5px;
		color: #333;
		font-weight: bold;
		border: 2px solid #888;
		text-transform: uppercase;
		width: 80%;
	}

	.listing-item a:focus, .listing-item a:focus .fsri-title, .listing-item a:focus img { opacity: 0.8; outline: none; }
	.listing-item a, .feast-category-index-list a { text-decoration: none !important; word-break: break-word; }
	li.listing-item:before { content: none !important; } /* needs to override theme */
	.fsri-list { padding-left: 0 !important; }
	.fsri-list .listing-item { margin: 0; }
	.fsri-list .listing-item img { display: block; }
	.fsri-list .feast_3x4_thumbnail { object-fit: cover; width: 100%; aspect-ratio: 3/4; }
	.fsri-list .feast_2x3_thumbnail { object-fit: cover; width: 100%; aspect-ratio: 2/3; }
	.fsri-list .feast_4x3_thumbnail { object-fit: cover; width: 100%; aspect-ratio: 4/3; }
	.fsri-list .feast_1x1_thumbnail { object-fit: cover; width: 100%; aspect-ratio: 1/1; }
	.fsri-title, .fsci-title { text-wrap: balance; }
	.listing-item { display: grid; } .fsri-rating, .fsri-time { place-self: end center; } /* align time + rating bottom */

	.feast-image-shadow { box-shadow: 3px 3px 5px #AAA; }

	.feast-grid-full { grid-template-columns: 1fr !important; }
	.feast-grid-half { grid-template-columns: repeat(2, minmax(0, 1fr)) !important; }
	.feast-grid-third { grid-template-columns: repeat(3, minmax(0, 1fr)) !important; }
	.feast-grid-fourth { grid-template-columns: repeat(4, minmax(0, 1fr)) !important; }
	.feast-grid-fifth { grid-template-columns: repeat(5, minmax(0, 1fr)) !important; }

		.feast-grid-full-horizontal .listing-item a > .fsri-title { width: 67%; padding: 0; text-align: left; margin-top: 0 !important; padding: 0 16px; }

		.feast-desktop-grid-half-horizontal .listing-item a > img, .feast-desktop-grid-full-horizontal a > img, .feast-desktop-grid-third-horizontal .listing-item a > img { width: 33%; margin-bottom: 0; }

have got a real treat for you today!</p><p>Countdown NZ sent me a mystery box full of Own Brand ingredients and challenged me to come up with a recipe using only the ingredients in the box plus a few extra pantry staples.</p><p>I put together the delicious ingredients that they sent me and created this show stopping boysenberry & white chocolate no bake cheesecake, and it’s a winner!</p><p>It has everything you love about traditional baked cheesecake but without the hassle of water baths and stressing over cracked tops. The filling is creamy, decadent and holds together perfectly once set. </p><p>The base is made up of crushed gingernut biscuits which gives the cheesecake an awesome flavour and helps offset the sweetness of the white chocolate. </p><figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><img decoding="async" width="750" height="1125" 	<div class="wprm-recipe-instructions-container wprm-recipe-12480-instructions-container wprm-block-text-normal" data-recipe="12480"><h3 class="wprm-recipe-header wprm-recipe-instructions-header wprm-block-text-bold wprm-align-left wprm-header-decoration-none" style="">Instructions</h3><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-group"><ul class="wprm-recipe-instructions"><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-0" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;"><span style="display: block;">Put the frozen berries in a small sieve to thaw and drain over a bowl. Once thawed, press out most of the liquid and discard, and add the thawed berries to a small saucepan with the maple syrup. Cook over a medium heat for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat and put in the fridge to cool until needed.</span></div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-1" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;"><span style="display: block;">Crush the biscuits using a food processor, blender or in a bag with a rolling pin. Stir in the caster sugar and melted butter and press into a 23cm/9 inch round springform cake tin. Use a measuring cup to make sure the base is pressed down really firmly so that it holds together when set. Place the tin in the fridge to start setting.</span></div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-2" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;">In a heatproof bowl combine ¼ cup of the cream with the chocolate and microwave in 20 second increments, stirring each time until melted or place the bowl over a pot of water on a medium heat and stir until melted. Allow to cool slightly.</div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-3" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;">Using a handheld or stand mixer with the whisk attachment, whip the remaining cream until stiff peaks form. Set aside.</div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-4" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;">Using a handheld or stand mixer with the paddle attachment whip the cream cheese and caster sugar for 3-4 minutes on medium-high speed until the mixture is fluffy and there are no lumps of cream cheese. Add the chocolate/cream mixture, icing sugar (if using) and lemon juice and mix on medium-high speed for a further 2-3 minutes, until the mixture lightens in colour and is fluffy. Gently fold through the whipped cream.</div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-5" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;">Spoon half of the filling onto the biscuit base. Drop 3-4 tablespoons of berry sauce on top of the filling and use a fork to swirl through the filling. Repeat with the remaining filling and berry sauce.</div></li><li id="wprm-recipe-12480-step-0-6" class="wprm-recipe-instruction" style="list-style-type: decimal;"><div class="wprm-recipe-instruction-text" style="margin-bottom: 5px;">Refrigerate for at least 6 hours and up to 48 hours (overnight is preferable) before serving.</div></li></ul></div></div>
